description.narrative: In Moldova there are registered over 180000 people with disabilities recognized to be the most vulnerable social group in terms of social exclusion. Statistics show an annual increase of persons having a degree of disability. Unfortunately in Gagauzia an a utonomous region of Moldova this problem is not regarded as a priority by the government and NGOs. Entrepreneurship education is not conducted for persons with disabilities and their right to education and labor rights are very limited. This project contri butes from its part to tackle this shortcoming in the Republic of Moldova.The goal of the project is to promote the right to education and employment of persons with disabilities through the development of their entrepreneurial skills and assistance in sta rting their own business in Moldova. This project was designed to improve the quality of life and livelihoods of persons with disabilities in Moldova by building their capacity to exercise their rights to employment. The Institute for Democracy will implem ent three key activities of the project which include the following actions: 1. Legal assistance for persons with disabilities in starting their own business by establishing a Center of Free Legal Assistance for the Persons with Disabilities. Center's work focuses on settling labor disputes between persons with disabilities and their employers as well as helping to fill documents. 2. Intensive training package for persons with disabilities on the ways and means of starting their own business entrepreneurshi p development. Also collection of the laws under a titled Principles of Entrepreneurship will be prepared and published in order to ease the access to the needed information. 3.Training for persons with disabilities on the Convention on the Rights of Perso ns with Disabilities.
